questions.sentence: If you ___ the form by Friday, your application will be processed immediately.
questions.explanation: In an if-clause referring to the future, use the present simple: 'If you submit..., will be processed...'.

questions.sentence: The brochures were printed ___ recycled paper to reduce waste.
questions.explanation: 'Printed on' is the standard collocation for the material/surface used.

questions.sentence: The new policy applies to employees who work ___ at least three days a week.
questions.explanation: An adverb is needed to modify the verb 'work': 'work remotely'.

questions.sentence: The supplier offered a discount ___ we placed the order before the end of the week.
questions.explanation: 'Provided (that)' introduces a condition meaning 'on the condition that'.

questions.sentence: Each of the invoices ___ checked for accuracy before payment is approved.
questions.explanation: 'Each of' is treated as singular: 'Each of the invoices is checked...'.

questions.sentence: The conference will be held ___ the main auditorium on the second floor.
questions.explanation: Use 'in' for events inside a room or building: 'held in the auditorium'.

questions.sentence: Please keep your receipt in case you need to ___ the item.
questions.explanation: After 'to', use the base verb form: 'to return'.

questions.sentence: The candidate spoke ___ about his previous experience leading teams.
questions.explanation: An adverb is needed to modify the verb 'spoke': 'spoke persuasively'.

questions.sentence: The report contains the most ___ sales figures to date.
questions.explanation: 'Up-to-date' is the adjective meaning 'current' and fits before a noun.

questions.sentence: The marketing budget for this quarter is ___ than last quarter's.
questions.explanation: Use the comparative form 'larger' to compare two things.

questions.sentence: Our IT help desk is available 24 hours a day, ___ weekends.
questions.explanation: Use 'including' to add an item to a list: '..., including weekends'.

questions.sentence: The CEO asked that the proposal ___ revised before the meeting.
questions.explanation: In formal requests ('ask that'), the subjunctive base form is used: 'be revised'.

questions.sentence: The new software is compatible ___ both Windows and macOS.
questions.explanation: 'Compatible with' is the correct preposition.

questions.sentence: A list of approved vendors will be sent to you ___.
questions.explanation: 'Shortly' is an adverb meaning 'soon' and fits after 'will be sent'.

questions.sentence: The staff members were thanked for ___ hard during the busy season.
questions.explanation: After 'for', use a noun or gerund: 'for working hard'.

questions.sentence: The auditorium was filled with guests, many of ___ had traveled from overseas.
questions.explanation: After the preposition 'of', use the object form 'whom': 'many of whom'.

questions.sentence: Because the training session starts promptly at 9:00, please arrive ___ 8:45.
questions.explanation: 'By' indicates a deadline (no later than 8:45).

questions.sentence: The company will reimburse travel expenses ___ receipts are provided.
questions.explanation: 'As long as' expresses a condition required for reimbursement.

questions.sentence: The invoice should be paid within 30 days of ___.
questions.explanation: 'Issue' is a noun here meaning the act/date of being issued: 'within 30 days of issue'.

questions.sentence: Mr. Garcia is the employee ___ ideas helped improve the process.
questions.explanation: Use 'whose' to show possession: 'whose ideas'.

questions.sentence: The hotel offers complimentary breakfast ___ all guests.
questions.explanation: Use 'for' to indicate who receives a benefit: 'for all guests'.

questions.sentence: The presentation was postponed due to technical problems, and the speakers apologized ___ the delay.
questions.explanation: Use 'apologize for' + noun/gerund to state what you are sorry about.

questions.sentence: We are looking for a candidate with ___ attention to detail.
questions.explanation: An adjective is needed to modify the noun phrase 'attention to detail': 'careful attention'.

questions.sentence: The new branch office will open in May, ___ will create about 30 jobs.
questions.explanation: Use 'which' to refer to the whole preceding clause in a non-restrictive relative clause.

questions.sentence: The project manager met with the team to discuss the tasks ___ for the next phase.
questions.explanation: 'Assigned' is a past participle used as an adjective: 'the tasks assigned...'.

questions.sentence: Please do not hesitate to contact me if you have ___ questions.
questions.explanation: 'Further questions' means 'additional questions' (not physical distance).

questions.sentence: The equipment must be handled with care to prevent it from being ___.
questions.explanation: After 'being', use the past participle: 'being damaged'.

questions.sentence: The company newsletter is distributed ___ a monthly basis.
questions.explanation: 'On a monthly basis' is the standard expression.

questions.sentence: Not only ___ the seminar informative, but it was also practical.
questions.explanation: With 'Not only' at the start, subject-auxiliary inversion is required: 'Not only was...'.

questions.sentence: The customer service representative handled the complaint ___ and resolved the issue quickly.
questions.explanation: An adverb is needed to modify the verb 'handled': 'handled ... professionally'.
